author: {'steamid': '76561198001148159', 'num_games_owned': 1018, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1690006546}
review:
Basically alright. Metroidvania with some Zelda-esque dungeons. Not all spells have unlock utility and there's no "dungeon will now test your mastery" moments though, so structure can feel a bit strange at times. 

Could use a bit of balancing here and there (countered by the rather powerful potions you can carry) as there are some weird difficulty spikes and using some of the offensive spells feels almost mandatory (your melee option is extremely close range and some of the hazards are not easily dodgeable. Some of the pickups are rather well hidden as I combed the map (on that note, there is no in-game map) to a degree I considered thorough but ended with 97% still. Backtracking is rewarded well enough, even if compared to other Metroidvanias the amount of unique pickups can feel somewhat sparse.

author: {'steamid': '76561199103771345', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1681949150}
review:
First of all, I want to say that I really like the game. The menu is simple and doesn't tire the eyes, the music is very compatible with the game and doesn't get boring while playing. While I thought it was an easy game, my thoughts changed in the first boss. The monsters are so well thought out, you can't escape even if you want to.
Thanks to everyone involved.
*a tip, if you skip some stairs to get through the levels quickly, you may not have that key when they ask you for a chest key in the future :)

author: {'steamid': '76561199385311553', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1681932277}
review:
[Português]

"Tim-Tim 2: The Almighty Gnome" é um jogo que vai te levar de volta aos tempos áureos dos jogos de RPG de ação, com elementos nostálgicos que trazem uma ótima sensação de voltar no tempo.

Até onde cheguei, a história do jogo é simples, nada para você ficar quebrando a cabeça. A trilha sonora é perfeitamente nostálgica e adequada à atmosfera, e as mecânicas são fáceis de aprender. Eu diria que o que tornou esse jogo tão agradável para mim foi justamente sua simplicidade e sua ambientação, foi como uma viagem aos bons jogos do passado.

Meu ponto favorito no jogo foi sem dúvida as dungeons, nelas me senti realmente desafiado e a grande quantidade de inimigos torna tudo ainda mais desafiador. Eu realmente gosto disso.

Em questão à gameplay, o jogo possui variedades de armas das quais você pode utilizar para ferir inimigos, desde magias até pedras que coleta no chão. As lutas contra os chefes são divertidas e têm seu nível de desafio.

O desempenho do jogo é ótimo, com gráficos e animações fluidas. Não há atrasos ou falhas, o que torna a jogabilidade ainda mais agradável.

Em conclusão geral, é um grande achado pelo seu preço, ainda mais se você for fã de jogos retro ou RPG.

[English]

"Tim-Tim 2: The Almighty Gnome" is a game that will take you back to the golden age of action RPG games, with nostalgic elements that bring a great feeling of going back in time.

As far as I've gotten, the game's story is simple, nothing to break your head over. The soundtrack is perfectly nostalgic and fitting to the atmosphere, and the mechanics are easy to learn. I would say that what made this game so enjoyable for me was precisely its simplicity and its setting, it was like a trip to the good games of the past.

My favorite point in the game was undoubtedly the dungeons, in which I really felt challenged and the large number of enemies makes everything even more challenging. I really like that.

Regarding gameplay, the game has a variety of weapons that you can use to harm enemies, from magic to stones that you collect on the ground. Boss fights are fun and have their level of challenge.

The game's performance is great, with fluid graphics and animations. There are no delays or failures, which makes gameplay even more enjoyable.

In general conclusion, it is a great find for its price, especially if you are a fan of retro or RPG games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157043382', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1680246521}
review: It's a game that you should definitely try, the pixel art is beautiful and the music is impressive. Mechanics are fine. If you are interested in such games, definitely try it. If you haven't heard of it, give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198875458148', 'num_games_owned': 19, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1679658694}
review: I highly recommend this game because it's really fun to play. The animation, quality, and sound/music effects of the game are great. It's very relaxing to play, even if you're losing in the game, you won't get stressed. It brings back my childhood games. I really enjoy the boss fights in this game as they are really exciting and challenging. The story is also great, and I plan to finish the game until I complete the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198837772214', 'num_games_owned': 31, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1679509326}
review: The game is very fun and enjoyable. It feels like you're playing a newfound version of Mario. I recommend it to everyone

author: {'steamid': '76561199210881486', 'num_games_owned': 1, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1679175503}
review: This game is a charming and delightful sidescrolling adventure. The graphics and sound design are top-notch, creating a magical and immersive world for the player to explore. The gameplay is challenging but rewarding, with plenty of treasure to find and secrets to uncover. The townsfolk are interesting and add depth to the world, while the square shaped mushrooms are a fun and quirky touch. Overall, TIM-TIM 2: "THE ALMIGHTY GNOME" is a must-play for anyone who loves adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198301342853', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1669740899}
review: This game fixed my broken marriage. It restored my bond with my children and they now love me. Thank you Spoonweaver, I am forever in your debt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997053623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1661028516}
review:
A charming little mini-metroidvania. Basic mechanics, very contained world, minimalist presentation, and a simple story - no surprises or anything groundbreaking, and yet I liked it more than many higher-budget games I played recently. No unnecessary crafting systems, random generation, RPG mechanics, fan service, or staggering difficulty - TT2 knows exactly what it is, and isn't trying to be anything else.

Not to say it's all great though. Even though the world is pretty small, it's still large enough to get lost in, and complete lack of a map doesn't help. The game's inventory, or rather its encumbrance system feel a bit too involved and out of place in an otherwise very straight-forward game. You can only carry a grand total of 25 items across all types, and as your inventory is constantly clogged with junk Tim Tim auto-collects, it all has to be purged any time you come across a store.
Lastly, I can't ignore the elephant in the room - the frame rate! For some unfathomable reason the game is locked at only 15 fps! Why? I have no idea whatsoever, but it does harm the overall experience, and should the game be even a little more challenging, would've been a deal-breaker, alas, it's all still surprisingly playable.

Oh, and I finished it from start to finish on a Steam Deck, so that answers the question of its compatibility.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119009586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1660949422}
review: The world is huge and the dungeons are just the right side of difficult. The end dungeon is hard as nails.

author: {'steamid': '76561198338913946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1652835337}
review: Tim Tim 2 is a short and simple sidescroller that feels like a game you would have played before. It's a very short game, in that you can probably beat it in about 2 hours. Boss battles have simple enough patterns that could be challenging for younger audiences but could take a couple of tries for casual gamers, but they are well executed and not what you would expect, with the exception of the second dungeon boss. The story is very very simple, but the twist at the end is a solid laugh out loud moment. Tim-Tim 2 is a short game at a fair price and is worth your time if you are looking for a fun all ages sidescroller for your kid. It's linear for the most part but there's enough branching paths that help it scratch a non-linear itch for those who like to find their own way. Controls are tight and it plays perfectly with a game pad.
